intro: Acrocephalus callianthus, commonly known as the red-headed grass or red-headed spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense clusters of reddish-brown spikelets at the top. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and along riverbanks. Acrocephalus callianthus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in moist conditions.
